metadata.Title: CVE-2019-1785 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability in the RAR file scanning functionality of Clam AntiVirus (ClamAV) Software versions 0.101.1 and 0.101.0 could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service condition on an affected device. The vulnerability is due to a lack of proper error-handling mechanisms when processing nested RAR files sent to an affected device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted RAR file to an affected device. An exploit could allow the attacker to view or create arbitrary files on the targeted system.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-1785` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamav-base - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamav-daemon - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamav-freshclam - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamav-milter - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamav-testfiles - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamdscan - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.18.04.1
libclamav7 - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

libclamunrar7 - 0.100.1-1~ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: clamav package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.18.04.1').
libclamunrar package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.100.1-1~ubuntu0.18.04.1').
